title: When a number is multiplied 5 times with itself, it gives the value of 1,445. What is the number? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the no is x. Five times a number is 5x.multiply both we get ans =1445.now write the equation X. 5x=1445 5x.x=1445 Divide both side by 5,we get x. x=289 So, x=sqrt of 289 x=17is the answer. Now check your answer by multiplying 17and 5.17 17x85=1445 which is given to you in the question.

A number is multiplied 5 times with itself, can be written in the exponential form as…. Let the number be ‘a' So, a x a^5 = a^6 & a^6 = 1445 => a^6 = (17√5)² => a^6 = {( cube root 17√5 ) }^6 => a = cube root 17√5 ( as exponents are equal, so base should be equal) So, cube root of 17√5 , when multiplied 5 times with itself, the required no ie (17√5 )^1/3 x {( 17√5)^1/3}^5 the product = {(17√5)^1/3}^6 = 17√5 x 17√5 = 1445 Ans: (17√5)^1/3
